body:
> Again, I believe every feature can be misused. It's not the language's
responsibilities to prevent bad use. We have golint and other tools for
that. I think this is one of Go's strong point: we use tools, not arbitrary
language limitations,to prevent bad style (gofmt is one prominent example).

Respectfully, you are rewriting history to suit your argument. The Go FAQ is littered with examples of features that Go chose _not_ to implement because while convenient, they were felt on balance to be to complex, or to easy to misuse. Some examples include:

- https://golang.org/doc/faq#assertions
- https://golang.org/doc/faq#Does_Go_have_a_ternary_form
- https://golang.org/doc/faq#inheritance
